properties.title: What caused the fire?
properties.text1: Map showing land surface temperature from April 26–May 3, 2016. Red areas were hotter than the 2000–2010 average for the same one-week period, blue areas were cooler.
properties.text2:
Wildfire scientist Mike Flanigan answers the crucial question:
"'This is a result of human-caused climate change. There's a lot of year-to-year variability with area burned, but we have doubled it.'
According to research Flannigan published in the journal Climatic Change, for every degree in warming, 15 per cent more precipitation is needed to offset the risk of wildfire from drying fuel."
